UndoEngine+UndoUnit Class

In this Article

Encapsulates a unit of work that a user can undo.

Syntax

Declaration

protected class UndoEngine.UndoUnit

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • UndoEngine+UndoUnit

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)

Remarks

The UndoEngine.UndoUnit class is a nested class within UndoEngine that encapsulates an action that a user can undo. The default UndoEngine.UndoUnit implementation monitors change notifications and builds up a list of events for each change. It saves these events using IDesignerSerializationService. An UndoEngine.UndoUnit receives event notifications for changes directly from UndoEngine through several public``virtual methods. You can derive from UndoEngine.UndoUnit and perform any additional logic. If desired, you can completely bypass the default UndoEngine.UndoUnit implementation.

Constructors

    Initializes a new instance of the UndoEngine+UndoUnit class.

    public UndoUnit (System.ComponentModel.Design.UndoEngine engine, string name);

    Parameters

    • engine
      UndoEngine

      The undo engine that owns this undo unit.

    • name
      String

      The name for this undo unit.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      engine is null.

Properties

  • IsEmpty

    Gets a value indicating whether the UndoEngine+UndoUnit contains no events.

    public virtual bool IsEmpty { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the UndoEngine+UndoUnit contains no events; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The undo engine may discard empty units.

  • Name

    Gets the name of the UndoEngine+UndoUnit.

    public string Name { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The name of the UndoEngine+UndoUnit.

  • UndoEngine

    Gets the parent UndoEngine.

    protected System.ComponentModel.Design.UndoEngine UndoEngine { get; }

    Property Value

    • UndoEngine

      The UndoEngine to which this UndoEngine+UndoUnit is attached.

Methods

  • Close()

    Receives a call from the undo engine to close this unit.

    public virtual void Close ();

    Remarks

    When a unit is closed, no more events can come into its various event methods. The UndoEngine+UndoUnit itself may take action here to ensure that any events that are currently open are closed.

  • ComponentAdded(ComponentEventArgs)

    Receives a call from the UndoEngine in response to a ComponentAdded event.

    public virtual void ComponentAdded (System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentEventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      ComponentEventArgs

      A ComponentEventArgs that contains the event data.

  • ComponentAdding(ComponentEventArgs)

    Receives a call from the UndoEngine in response to a ComponentAdding event.

    public virtual void ComponentAdding (System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentEventArgs e);

    • e
      ComponentEventArgs

    Receives a call from the UndoEngine in response to a ComponentChanged event.

    public virtual void ComponentChanged (System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs e);

      ComponentChangedEventArgs

  • ComponentChanging(ComponentChangingEventArgs)

    Receives a call from the UndoEngine in response to a ComponentChanging event.

    public virtual void ComponentChanging (System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangingEventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      ComponentChangingEventArgs

      A ComponentChangedEventArgs that contains the event data.

  • ComponentRemoved(ComponentEventArgs)

    Receives a call from the UndoEngine in response to a ComponentRemoved event.

    public virtual void ComponentRemoved (System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentEventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      ComponentEventArgs

      A ComponentEventArgs that contains the event data.

  • ComponentRemoving(ComponentEventArgs)

    Receives a call from the UndoEngine in response to a ComponentRemoving event.

    public virtual void ComponentRemoving (System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentEventArgs e);

    • e
      ComponentEventArgs

      A ComponentEventArgs that contains the event data.

  • ComponentRename(ComponentRenameEventArgs)

    Receives a call from the UndoEngine in response to a ComponentRename event.

    public virtual void ComponentRename (System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentRenameEventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      ComponentRenameEventArgs

      A ComponentRenameEventArgs that contains the event data.

  • GetService(Type)

    Gets an instance of the requested service.

    protected object GetService (Type serviceType);

    Parameters

    • serviceType
      Type

      The type of service to retrieve.

    Returns

    • System.Object

      An instance of the given service, or null if the service cannot be resolved.

  • ToString()

    Returns a String that represents the current name of the unit.

    public override string ToString ();

    Returns

    • String

      A String that represents the current name of the unit.

  • Undo()

    Performs an undo or redo action.

    public void Undo ();

    Remarks

    Undo actions toggle themselves between undo and redo states, so calling Undo twice sets the object back to its original state.

    The UndoEngine+UndoUnit class initially assumes that the undoable work has already been done, so the first call to Undo undoes the work. The next call undoes the previous undo operation, performing a redo.

    The Undo method calls the UndoCore method to perform an undo operation. The Undo method itself works to maintain consistent state within the UndoEngine+UndoUnit, even in the event of an exception thrown by UndoCore.

  • UndoCore()

    Called by stem.ComponentModel.Design.UndoEngine.UndoUnit.Undo* to perform an undo action.

    protected virtual void UndoCore ();

    Remarks

    The Undo method calls the UndoCore method to perform an undo operation. The Undo method itself works to maintain consistent state within the UndoEngine+UndoUnit, even in the event of an exception thrown by UndoCore.
